result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindy L Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cindy L Fuller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cindy L Fuller was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cindy L Fuller

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Minutes emailed to DOC

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Cindy L Fuller in court.  Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen in court for Cindy L Fuller.  Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM -2, 3, 4

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1     
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 1 year in the DCJ, with Huber, cc to 21CF2729, 21CF2875 and 21CF2520

-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 21CF2729, 21CF2875 and 21CF2520

CONDITIONS:
-Maintain full-time employment, unless proof of disability is provided
-File tax returns every year and provide a copy to Agent. Any refunds received are to be paid towards restitution. 

-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: Parties have 30 days to submit a letter regarding credit. 

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]
Pretrial Services violation report; Court response no change continue to monitor

5-18-22 minutes and bond forms emailed to DCJ

SIGNATURE BOND SET - $500 PER CASE - REFERRAL TO DANE COUNTY PRETRIAL SERVICES
  You may be responsible for paying the amount of your signature bond if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
-The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17
Referral DCPS

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing in cases 21CF2520, 21CF2729, 21CF2875 and 22CF398. State gives argument. Atty Vander Meulen gives argument. Court makes findings and orders a signature bond in all of the cases along with pretrial services for GPS monitoring. For case 21CF2875and 21CF2520 the posted cash bail of $300.00 is to be returned to the poster.

Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

10:40 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nicole Vander Meulen.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
